intro: Talinum umbellatum, commonly known as red root or redstem, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a reddish underside, and it produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its roots are often reddish in color, which contributes to its common name. Talinum umbellatum is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
